results.title: Love is the devil: study for a portrait of Francis Bacon
results.creator_credit: BBC Film Unit, BFI, Chiara Menage and John Maybury
results.brief_description: Love is the Devil: A Study For A Portrait of Francis Bacon is indeed a portrait in the style of controversial British painter Bacon. Like Bacon’s confronting yet compelling portraits, John Maybury’s film intensely focuses on its subject - revelling in distortion and pain. The film follows the turbulent, sado-masochistic relationship Bacon (Derek Jacobi) had with George Dwyer (Daniel Craig), who he meets when he accidently stumbles upon Dwyer attempting to burgle Bacon’s meagre apartment. Francis simply says to George: “Take off your clothes. Come to bed and you can have whatever you want”. The relationship has a destructive effect on the passive George who feels uncomfortable with Bacon’s eccentric friends (Tilda Swinton is especially creepy as one of this coterie), and who is continually tortured by Bacon’s sadistic enjoyment of pain and suffering. Derek Jacobi and Daniel Craig are excellent as the two main characters.

results.title: Love is a planned family
results.creator_credit: Oxford Films (U.S.), Richard Tyson and Richard Tyson, MD
results.brief_description: Documents the viewpoints of several individuals on family planning and methods of birth control, revealing that they are motivated by love - by a very deep concern for their families, including members yet unborn. Interwoven with the why of family planning is a discussion of the effectiveness of birth control methods. The pill, spermicidal foam, IUD, rhythm, diaphragm and condom are among those covered.

results.title: Love is a many-splendored thing = Love is a many splendored thing [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Buddy Adler and Henry King
results.brief_description: Adapted from the novel by Han Suyin, “Love is a many splendored-thing” is a film about an inter-racial romance, shot on location in Hong Kong and filmed in Cinemascope. Set in Hong Kong 1949, the film centres on the love affair of Dr Han Suyin (Jennifer Jones) and Mark Elliot (William Holden). She is a dedicated and talented doctor of Eurasian background, working in a local hospital, who longs for her Chinese homeland. He is an American war correspondent covering the Korean War, temporarily based in Hong Kong. When Suyin meets Elliot she is alerted to the fact that he is married and is warned that a cross-cultural relationship is a perilous move. The racism and snobbery of the British social network of Hong Kong is made clear, particularly in the initial stages of the film. The expectations of Suyin’s Chinese family and colleagues are that she will behave in the culturally expectant Chinese way. Suyin is proud of her Eurasian heritage but is also made acutely aware of her cultural difference and status as an outsider, despite being respected professionally. Winner of three Academy Awards, including Best Song.

results.title: Love in a Cold Climate
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Kate Harwood and Tom Hooper
results.brief_description: Love In A Cold Climate is the story of three girls and their journey into adulthood. What is most important to Polly, Fanny and Linda is their launching into society where they hope to meet future husbands and fall in love along the way. Set in England in the early 1930’s we meet the eccentric families of the girls and travel between the country houses of England to the drawing rooms of London’s high society all in the pursuit of love. Cast includes Elisabeth Dermot-Walsh, Rosamund Pike, Megan Dodds, Anthony Andrews, Alan Bates.

results.title: Love from Guy
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Carolyn Johnson and Sandra Lepore
results.brief_description: Played out as a series of video confessions, Love from Guy follows the downward trajectory of Guy (Angelo d’Angelo) a likable but conflicted young man from an Italian background. After Guy’s wife walks out on him, he tries to piece together the reasons why she left by recording a video letter intended for her. Director Sandra Lepore’s short drama explores the ambivalence felt by the protagonist as he tries to reconcile his family’s background and conflicting values which are wrecking havoc on his relationship. Cast includes Les Chantery, Francesca Radice, George Rubiu, Gina Bortolin.

results.title: Love Della
results.brief_description: This is a 50’s home movie style portrait of a fictional 19 year old, undiscovered jazz starlet, called Della Ray ( Kate Cebrano).Though recently shot, the film masquerades convincingly as found footage of a 50’s jazz club and its inhabitants. It begins with a roller coaster jam session featuring unknown local musicians of 1958, and ends with an impromptu number by the delightful Delia herself, who “died” in the tradition of thejazz greats, shortly after the footage was shot. Features excellent original 50’s jazz numbers.

results.title: Love and other catastrophes
results.creator_credit: Newvision Films, Screwball Five, Stavros Andonis Efthymiou and Emma-Kate Croghan
results.brief_description: A warm and witty screwball comedy about love, fate and other pressing concerns. Mia and Alice have just moved into a warehouse apartment but are still minus a housemate. Danni, Mia’s girlfriend is keen to move in, but Mia fears commitment. Mia is obsessed with her favourite lecturer and becomes embroiled in a bureaucratic nightmare as she pursues him to his new department. Alice, a frustrated perfectionist is looking for the perfect man, but cant find anyone who fits her rigorous criteria. Feeling the need for a change she falls for the most unsuitable man possible, Aria part-time gigolo. Little does she know she has her own secret admirer, Michael a shy medical student who is living in the share house from hell, and wants out! Their search for love transcends the boundaries of the Universtiy and their respective disciplines.
